summary: the aim of this study was to investigate the association of rs12252 C polymorphism, BMI, diabetes, and hypercholesterolemia with mild flu in an Iranian population. the study included 79 mild flu and 125 flu-negative individuals attending primary care centers of three provinces of the country. this is the first study evaluating the association between rs12252 polymorphisms, diabetes, hypercholesterolemia, and BMI and susceptibility to mild flu in an Iranian population. results suggest a significant positive association between mild flu and rs12252 C allele heterozygous and carriage.
